image.altText: A close up of a phone against a woman's ear.

props.synopsis: About 20 per cent of calls to South Australia's domestic violence crisis line are going unanswered, despite a recent boost in government funding to address demand, the state's peak body for domestic violence services says.

title.children: One in five calls to SA DV crisis line go unanswered despite extra funding

image.altText: A 19th century single story manor house with a sign reading Ayers House in foreground

props.synopsis: Volunteer-run branches of the conservation charity, responsible for maintaining some of SA's most well-known landmarks, protest a new "service fee" on their earnings.

title.children: Leaked emails reveal National Trust's financial dispute with SA volunteers

image.altText: Adelaide Crows player Isaac  Cumming pumps his fist during an AFL match

props.synopsis: From summers spent training with Taylor Walker as a teen in Broken Hill to running out alongside him for his 100th game, it has been a wild ride for Isaac Cumming.

title.children: Crows' Isaac Cumming to mark 100 games alongside childhood idol

image.altText: A man stands in the foreground with a picture of another man on a screen in the background.

props.synopsis: Police believe the missing remains of alleged murder victim Julian Story have been found by a member of the public, but say testing will be undertaken to confirm. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: SA Police believe missing remains of Julian Story have been found

image.altText: A composite image of Anna Panella, Bernard Skeffington and Graham Jessett

props.synopsis: A South Australian coroner has called on the state government to "formally acknowledge" ramping is "a reality" and focus on making it safer for those who will "inevitably" experience it.

title.children: Coroner calls on SA government to make hospitals safer amid ramping death findings

image.altText: A man in a blue and red shirt and jacket holding a lobster in a white room.

props.synopsis: The harmful algal bloom is already impacting the fishing industry, with producers asking customers to keep buying to avoid piling on pain.

title.children: SA fishers urge people to keep buying seafood amid algal bloom

image.altText: Damage car off cliff

props.synopsis: The owner of a car that rolled out of a driveway and dropped 40 metres from a cliff, south of Adelaide, says he was trying to charge the vehicle's battery when the incident occurred.

title.children: Car rolls out of driveway, goes over cliff, south of Adelaide

image.altText: A man in a dark cap and jacket holds his arms up and points his finger at the camera in a theatre hall

props.synopsis: Hip hop artist Bousta is one of 13 emerging South Australia artists who will perform in front of music heavyweights in the annual Scouted showcase.

title.children: 'Catch my vibe': First Nations hip hop artist sings in two languages

image.altText: A man and a woman, both wearing blue suits, smile as they hold hands and walk outside a court building

props.synopsis: A court has heard that former MP Annabel Digance and her husband Greg were found guilty by a District Court Judge of blackmailing Premier Peter Malinauskas, but that the charge was dropped in exchange for them agreeing to leave the-then opposition leader alone.

title.children: Former MP who is suing SA Premier found guilty of blackmail, before charges were dropped

image.altText: Four giant Australian cuttlefish are seen close up at a low angle under water. they are purple and grey in colour.

props.synopsis: Ecologists are racing to figure out how to preserve South Australia's giant Australian cuttlefish hatchlings amid the algal bloom — but agree that time is of the essence.

title.children: Scramble to understand giant cuttlefish behaviour as algal bloom looms

image.altText: a bowl of oysters

props.synopsis: The state government has closed Cowell's Franklin Harbour, one of South Australia's biggest oyster growing regions, as a toxic algal bloom continues to spread in the state's waters.

title.children: Major SA oyster region temporarily shut as toxic algal bloom spreads

image.altText: A Thomas Foods truck outside of a factory

props.synopsis: One of the nation's biggest food businesses has scaled back operations at its Adelaide Hills site as the state battles the impact of ongoing drought.

title.children: Thomas Foods International scales back Adelaide Hills operations due to drought

image.altText: Mike Burgess wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Australia's top domestic spy chief Mike Burgess has used a speech to give his most detailed account yet of the scale of the threat of foreign interference.

title.children: ASIO disrupted 24 'major' espionage operations in three years, spy chief reveals

image.altText: Sussan Ley watching on from the frontbench

props.synopsis: Parliament is back in full swing as the new opposition leader settled in and the prime minister resorted to an election campaign stunt.

title.children: Sussan Ley finds her feet as Albanese reaches for the Medicare card again

image.altText: Primary school children using pencils in class

props.synopsis: Artarmon man David James was charged by Australian Federal Police with more than a dozen offences, including 10 counts of using a child under the age of 14 to make child abuse material.

title.children: Alleged paedophile worked at 58 out-of-school-hours care centres in Sydney

image.altText: An Indigenous man in traditional body paint dances.

props.synopsis: From the pain of a broken political promise and one community’s desire to push forward, the Garma festival was born.

title.children: The broken promise that has loomed over 25 years of Garma

image.altText: Conor McGregor in a blue suit and tie looking emotionless down at the ground while walking in front of a black turnstile gate

props.synopsis: Former mixed martial arts fighter Conor McGregor has lost his attempt to overturn a civil jury's order that he compensate a woman who accused him of raping her.

title.children: Conor McGregor loses his appeal against civil rape case

image.altText: FBI director Kash Patel is wearing a suit and is amongst other smartly dressed people

props.synopsis: Kash Patel, who is a loyalist of US President Donald Trump, quietly stopped in Sydney before travelling to New Zealand to announce the United States would expand its FBI office in Wellington.

title.children: Home Affairs minister met with FBI director during secretive Australia visit

image.altText: A child has their teeth examined by a dentist.

props.synopsis: A survey has found Australia's free childhood dental scheme is cloaked in confusion and misinformation, with many parents either unaware of its existence or unsure of their children's eligibility.

title.children: More than 1.5 million children missing out on free dental care, data shows

image.altText: The exterior of a large, modern childcare centre photographed through lush gardens.

props.synopsis: Grow Early Education's Townsville centre, which has a history of not adequately supervising children, is under investigation again.

title.children: Queensland childcare centre with breach history under investigation again

image.altText: A photo of Muhammad's with back facing the camera, his mother holding him, inside a dark background.

props.synopsis: The image of a skeletal one-year-old Gazan boy wearing a bin-bag nappy and cradled in his mother's arms shocked the world, but questions around the child's underlying medical condition reveal the difficulty of telling stories inside Gaza.

title.children: Why this image of an emaciated Gazan boy sparked controversy

image.altText: A drone over orange flames.

props.synopsis: The fighting between Thailand and Cambodia exposes the depth of global arms proliferation in South-East Asia, proving more sophisticated and deadly than experts expected.

title.children: Cluster bomb claims, Swedish jets stir outcry in Thai-Cambodia clash

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: Small companies would pay less tax, but the largest could pay more under a new reform proposal from the independent agency tasked with helping to shape Labor's economic reform agenda.

title.children: Small business tax cut to 20pc under new reform proposal

image.altText: Six illustrated native animals .

props.synopsis: Move over, roos and emus — this National Science Week, we're looking for the most underrated Australian animal. Meet the contestants, and vote for who you think should win.

title.children: Meet the contestants for Australia's top underrated animal

image.altText: A rolled up piece of paper inside of a glass bottle cloudy with brown residue.

props.synopsis: A specialist painter was working on one of Australia's oldest lighthouses when they "found such an exciting thing" — a bottle with a message inside.

title.children: Message in a bottle discovered in lighthouse wall after 122 years

image.altText: Waves crash into a sea wall off a beach dotted with palm trees

props.synopsis: It was one of the strongest tremors in recorded history, but Wednesday's megathrust earthquake brought less tsunami damage than feared. Here are some factors that may have been at play.

title.children: Why Russia's 'megathrust' earthquake didn't cause a bigger tsunami

image.altText: Jane Hume and Sarah Henderson

props.synopsis: Among Opposition Leader Sussan Ley's multiple problems are two very unhappy former frontbenchers.

title.children: Aggrieved Liberals stamp their feet, testing Ley's authority

image.altText: A charred wreckage of a car illuminated in bright orange and red flames on piles of building rubble

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president has urged his allies to bring about "regime change" in Russia, hours after Moscow launched fresh drone and missile attacks on Kyiv, killing eight people including a six-year-old boy.

title.children: Zelenskyy calls for regime change in Russia as strikes on Kyiv continue

image.altText: A large stick insect amongst green leaves

props.synopsis: Naturalists make the discovery in the misty rainforests of Far North Queensland, where tree canopies reach more than 30 metres above the ground and many species are believed to still be unknown.

title.children: Newly discovered giant stick insect could be Australia's heaviest

image.altText: A group of Bulldogs AFL players high-five as fans wave a giant Bulldogs banner in the stand.

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs deliver under the roof at Docklands as they smash the Giants for four quarters and roar into the top eight, leaving GWS in real strife.

title.children: Bulldogs roar into top eight, smashing Giants at Docklands

image.altText: a portrait photograph of Kevin Bell wearing a suit in studio lighting

props.synopsis: A former Yoorrook justice commissioner and Victorian Aboriginal community leaders are urging the state government to make good on the "genuine promise" it made by setting up Australia's first Aboriginal-led truth-telling inquiry.

title.children: Former Yoorrook commissioner urges government to make good on its 'big promise'

image.altText: Two cavoodles wearing a pilot and air hostess costume

props.synopsis: The airline has now received the green light from Food Standards Australia New Zealand, a major regulatory hurdle that stalled the rollout after Virgin first announced the plan last year.

title.children: Virgin Australia to allow pets on board before the end of the year

image.altText: Oscar Piastri and Max Verstappen shake hands after a race in full racing suits

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri is coming off a brilliant win in Belgium last Sunday, establishing a 16-point lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship.

title.children: Verstappen stays at Red Bull, Piastri back at scene of first grand prix win

image.altText: A film still showing a woman wearing a red dress riding a vehicle, a woman in a white dress sitting behind her

props.synopsis: The cinematic love child of Bridesmaids and Die Hard, Bride Hard could have been a success — but instead it fails spectacularly, thanks to a razor-thin plot.

title.children: Bride Hard tries to combine Die Hard and Bridesmaids but fails both
